entity.name: COVID-19: Latest news updates from around the world
entity.description: This page is a timeline of Tweets with the latest information and updates on COVID-19 from experts, journalists, health authorities and other trusted sources from around the world. For more on COVID-19, visit: twitter.com/explore/tabs/covid-19

entity.name: Brazil health officials report first positive coronavirus test
entity.description: Brazil's Ministry of Health confirmed that a 61-year-old São Paulo man who had recently returned from Italy tested positive for the virus, and they are awaiting second test results. If confirmed, it would be the first case recorded in South America.

entity.name: Saudi Arabia temporarily bans religious visits to the kingdom amid coronavirus fears
entity.description: The kingdom announced it will suspend entry for religious purposes, including pilgrimages to Mecca and visits to the Prophet's Mosque in Medina, in an attempt to limit the spread of the coronavirus outbreak.

entity.name: President Trump puts VP Pence in charge of US response to coronavirus
entity.description: Donald Trump said the risk to the US from the deadly coronavirus “remains very low” and that he has put Vice President Mike Pence in charge of the American response to the outbreak.

text: @realDonaldTrump Yeah, you had a premonition coronavirus was coming, so you banned immigrants seeking asylum from South America, and immigrants from predominantly Muslim countries (except Saudi Arabia)because the virus epicenter was in *China*?
